p: To visualise a summary of gene expression of a panel of 94 candidate immune genes ( online supplemental table S7) for each participant, we plotted tape-derived gene expression along the first two principal components (PCs; PC1, x-axis; PC2, y-axis) representing the largest variance in the dataset. Each component is a linear combination of 94 immune genes ( figure 1A). Compared with samples from CLE-U and HVs, CLE-A were shifted forward on the x-axis of PC1, accounting for 60% of the total variance in the dataset. Within disease groups, CLE-A and CLE-U were separated from one another ( figure 1A). HVs were shifted slightly backward along PC1.
